channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic light facing the wrong way, 30th June
item.description:
Main road traffic light has been spun around (the one on the left) it's now facing the side road which already has a traffic light facing towards it (the one on the right) this is very dangerous and needs to be fixed asap thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 267, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Missing BOLLARDS allowing dangerous a rat run, 30th June
item.description:
Bull alley has always had and still should have Two fixed bollards approximately half way along it duration about two years ago they were removed to allow construction work mainly scaffolding to be carried out unfortunately they have not been replaced and traffic from the high street is now using this as a rat run it’s extremely dangerous as this is a public footpath/right of way I saw a van almost collided with a child today and I believe it’s just a matter of time also the original bollards were positioned beneath a very heavy phase 3 high voltage electrical cable that seems to link one motor dealer to another straight across the bull alley if a high vehicle catches the cable the results could be catastrophic the position of the now missing bollards are on your own maps please fix I have had to jump out of the way several times now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Giant Hogweed plants on roadside verge, 30th June
item.description:
There are several large Giant Hogweed (Heracleum mantegazzianum) plants growing along the roadside verge. This invasive plant poses a serious health risk as its sap can cause severe skin burns and blistering when exposed to sunlight. The plants have been there for at least a few weeks and are very tall with large white flower heads. Please arrange removal as soon as possible to protect public safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gosshill Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on church building, 30th June
item.description:
Hello. Would it be possible to remove graffiti from East Street Baptist Church, SE17 Walworth. There is grafitti on the metal shutter. (Please note that the shutter is in use 10-12 Tuesdays, so it won't be possible to clean then.) There is also graffiti on the church wall on Portland Street, near the main portcullis entrance. The church is a place of worship, as a well a place for the community through its services, coffee morning, youth clubs and parent and baby group. Your help would be very much appreciated!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Henshaw Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned rotting green bins since xmas, 30th June
item.description:
These 2 green bins were filled to the brim at Xmas and have been rotting away since. They also were dumped into the children's playground and then redumped. Bin men put a "wrong bin" sign on months ago. Please just remove both bins as there have been rats and swarms of flies

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colomb Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, The Grove, North Cray, Sidcup, London

item.title: Chairs outside barbers blocking pavement, 30th June
item.description:
Ebenezer's Barbers place chairs outside by their window. These aren't just for customers people sit, drink and blocking the street. Yesterday it was so bad people were having to cross over the road to get by. I have photos but don't want to share publicly.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Tree outside 125 Baring Road, 30th June
item.description:
I am writing to request that the overhanging tree branches in our area be cut back as a matter of safety and maintenance. Large vehicles such as the 261 and SL4 buses regularly strike the branches, posing a risk to road users and pedestrians. In addition to this, the low-hanging branches are encroaching on light and nearby properties, creating a nuisance. During the autumn months, the volume of falling leaves also causes significant mess and contributes to blocked drains. I would appreciate it if this issue could be addressed as soon as possible. This the has never been maintained and is out of control.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baring Road, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed food waste collection and green bin, 30th June
item.description:
Last week I reported my food waste collection missed to Lewisham council and said I was concerned about the heat causing maggots and flies. It still wasn't collected and now they have skipped it again but added bonus, they've also missed my green bin. No label put in bins just skipped. There are 5 people in this home and nowhere for recycling and food waste to empty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reigate Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
